page.title: 06DAYS GONE BY IN ARMTHORPE
page.content: {AFTER THE GREAT WAR:}With the opening of the pit, many people came to the village. One of the local farmers bought a motorbus and this meandered round picking up people and taking them to work and at night the bus was used to house chickens. {IN 1939 WORLD WAR II BEGAN:}At the Church of England school were air_raid shelters.They have been gone for 25 years.The Germans tried to bomb the pit,and failed. A gunner came down on Paxton Crescent and gunned doors. At this time there were no estates but many farms.Down Butterill Drive was Credland's farm and at Cow House Lane was a place where you could hire horses.Where Tranmoor School is were arable fields.At the back of Beavers' paper shop was a cobbler's and an undertaker called Crabtree.There were also many orchards in Armthorpe.
